title: You ain't from around here, are you? Message authoring guidance in social media

author: Pablo N. Mendes, IBM Almaden Research Center, IBM Research

segmentation: Yeah, so I will be talking about how to affectively message an audience.

All about how you say things, right?
So you could convey the same message and multiple ways, and if you choose your words wisely, you're more likely to be successful in whatever endeavor that you're pursuing.
So here for example, give me money as at least partially semantically related to the concept of donating rights and helping and making a difference.
These are all concepts are semantically related.

Depending on the context that you use them and our app is trying to help you first identify the language, that doesn't sound so well with your target audience and try to help you to find suitable substitutes for these.
For these phrases or entities and concepts so that you can target your audience more effectively.
So as you can see it before communicating about social issues is a potential use for the system.

Or if you want to do fund raising for some kind of relief action, or if you want to simply understand how people communicate in social media about political issues or whatever other issues that you worry about.
Or you could help journalism students or a psychologist to figure out how people choose their words.
And all of these things that can be supported by an app like ours that helps you to identify better ways to communicate.

One of the novelty aspects here is that I've never seen an app that does such a thing that would work, sort of as a spell checker for you, but not for how to write words correctly, but how to choose things that resonate better with your community.
On the research side, this is sort of not trying so previously I worked with DB Pedia Spotlight.
Try to notify given us an expression, what are the possible meanings of that expression.
This is sort of the other way around, so now you give me a concept and I try to find different phrasing, different ways to express that same concept in tech.
Then, given the context of a topic or not.
Commercial value I think this is something that I don't need to stress too much.
Being someone that's in industry now, it's very unlikely that I'm allowed to work on something that has no potential to bring money to the enterprise.
But I also think it's easy for everybody to imagine that there are millions and millions of dollars being invested in marketing efforts.
Of all kinds, and everybody wants their dollars to have great impact and reach the audience that they're going for.
But nobody wants to hit the wrong buttons there and make people angry.

And there are quite a few examples and have links references from the paper examples of successful campaigns and unsuccessful campaigns that went really bad, but perhaps could have been the bad ones could have been avoided then.
The good ones could have been helped if you had a tool that would help you to effectively message your audience.

About this community.
